bug.summary: load_vectors should accept arbitrary space characters as word tokens
bug.description:
This bug is similar to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/737>#737</denchmark-link> . Some space characters (such as the NO-BREAK SPACE U+00A0) are currently not detected as space by the load_vectors function, and the loading fails if the word vector files has such strings as token. I fixed the bug by detecting the expression at the beginning of each line, instead of ' '. I submitted a PR (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/pull/836>#836</denchmark-link> ). <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: Ubuntu 16.04 Python Version Used: 3.0.5 spaCy Version Used: HEAD
